intro: Perityle emoryi, commonly known as Emory's perityle, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and typical sunflower-like appearance. The plant produces small, daisy-like blossoms that range in color from white to pale yellow, often appearing in clusters. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, typically found in rocky soils and open habitats. Perityle emoryi is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native range.
